page.title: 06St.Mary's Church Beverstone.
page.content: Beverstone Church stands just to the north of the castle and is reached from a narrow track which leads off the A.4135.It is most attractively surrounded by open fields and farm buildings.The church is Norman in origin,but it was extended in 1361 when Thomas,Lord Berkeley refortified the castle.The church had fallen into disrepair by the nineteenth century so it was restored in 1842 and again in 1884.Of particular interest inside the building are the Berkeley Chapel and the ancient Rood Screen which spans the chancel arch.Outside the church,two notable features are the stone coffin covers built into the walls and the relief sculpture on the south face of the tower.
